page.title: 02MAIN FEATURES OF AMBLE AREA
page.content: The{Amble}area comprises two main settlements - Amble and the village of {Warkworth.}They are two contrasting areas of population and history. {Warkworth}to the{north-west of Amble is about{a mile away along the River {Coquet}and retains much of its {historical character}with{medieval {castle, church, bridge}and{layout of {burgage plots}which still are much in evidence in the landscape.{Amble {developed after the River Coquet {changed its course}from{a small manor {to an industrial port}with a{growing {population}in the nineteenth century. Amble developed as a result of the {demand for coal,}mined south of the town, and{exported from a busy harbour {built during the early part of the {nineteenth century.}Amble has grown with{the movement of villagers from {the surrounding areas}into the town.
